Module Cryptography
Package cryptography

Class Atbash

java.lang.Object
cryptography.Cipher
cryptography.SubstitutionCipher
cryptography.Affine
cryptography.Atbash
All Implemented Interfaces:
Crackable
public class Atbash
extends Affine
This class represents the Atbash cipher. The atbash cipher, also called the mirror cipher, is an Affine cipher with the keys (a=m, b=m), where m is the alphabet's length. Because of this, the cipher has incredibly low security, as there is only one possible solution for this cipher. This cipher is believed to be the first cipher ever used, its roots being the ancient egypt.

    • crack

      public java.lang.String[] crack()
      Returns an array containing all possible solutions for this cipher. Since the Atbash cipher has only one solution, the only element in the array is given by: this.decrypt()
      Specified by:
      crack in interface Crackable
      Overrides:
      crack in class Affine
      Returns:
      an array with all possible solutions for this cipher.
